summary: Diff adds a new AppointmentDashboard53 page with an embedded Calendly iframe and external-link fallbacks, registers a new TanStack Router route (/appointment-dashboard53), and updates Layout to include a top promotional banner area with a Calendly link and an appointment dashboard button. However, the diff snippet for Layout is truncated, so exact banner copy, exact button label, and link target/rel behavior in the banner cannot be fully verified from provided evidence.

missing_requirements.requirement: Banner renders the provided text exactly (including the Calendly URL) and the Calendly URL is clickable opening in a new tab with rel=noopener/noreferrer.
missing_requirements.reason: Layout.tsx is truncated before the promotional banner markup; the exact banner message text and link attributes cannot be confirmed from the visible diff content.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (mentions banner exists but does not show exact string/attributes)

missing_requirements.requirement: Banner includes a button directly below the ad copy labeled exactly "Connect with the appointment dashboard53" that routes in-app to the Appointment Dashboard53 page without full reload.
missing_requirements.reason: Layout.tsx is truncated before the banner/button markup; the exact button label and its routing behavior cannot be verified from the visible diff content.
evidence: frontend-file-summaries.txt (mentions appointment dashboard button but not exact label/handler)

hallucinated_features.description: Additional informational "About ANC Apprentice Program Center" card content on the Appointment Dashboard53 page.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-7 only asks for an embedded Calendly view plus a clear external-link fallback; the extra marketing/about section is not requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Extra UI/UX elements on the Appointment Dashboard53 page (Cards, icons, titles/descriptions beyond embed + fallback).
hallucinated_features.reason: Not explicitly requested; requirements focus on embedding Calendly and providing an external-link fallback.
